languageTools.program.agent.actions

Class DeleteAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • languageTools.program.agent.actions.Action
        • languageTools.program.agent.actions.MentalAction
          • languageTools.program.agent.actions.DeleteAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class DeleteAction
extends MentalAction
    Deletes an Update from the BeliefBase base and/or mail box. As these are two different databases that the agent maintains, two updates are associated with the delete action. One update for the agent's belief base and one for the agent's mail box.

    If the action is closed, the delete action can be performed, but only the update to the belief base is required to be closed. The update to the agent's mail box may contain variables in order to be able to remove interrogatives (questions) that have been sent or received from the mail box again.

    Percepts of the form percept(...) cannot be removed from the percept base by a delete action. Percepts are automatically removed from the agent's percept base every start of a reasoning cycle.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • DeleteAction

        public DeleteAction(Selector selector,
            Update beliefUpdate,
            Update mailboxUpdate,
            InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates a DeleteAction that removes a belief from the BeliefBase of an agent; also may remove content from the mail box.
        Parameters:
        selector - The Selector of this action.
        beliefUpdate - The Update to be removed from to the BeliefBase.
        mailboxUpdate - The Update to be removed from the mail box.
        source - The source code location of this action, if available; null otherwise.

      • getFreeVar

        public java.util.Set<Var> getFreeVar()
        Returns the (free) variables that occur in the selector of this action and the Update that is to be removed from the BeliefBase by this DeleteAction as well as the variables that occur in the update that is to be performed on the mail box.
        Specified by:
        getFreeVar in class Action
        Returns:
        The (free) variables that occur in the selector of this action and the updates to the belief base and mail box.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Checks whether the Update to the BeliefBase and the Selector is closed, i.e., both do not have any occurrences of (free) variables.

        Note that we consider the DeleteAction to be closed even though the update to the mail box may contain free variables! We need to allow for free variables in the mail box update in order to be able to remove interrogatives, i.e., questions, from the mailbox. As a consequence, the isClosed() method cannot simply be defined in terms of the getFreeVar() method.

        Overrides:
        isClosed in class Action
        Returns:
        true if the belief update and selector are closed; false otherwise.

      • applySubst

        public DeleteAction applySubst(Substitution pSubst)
        Applies the given Substitution to the Updates associated with this InsertAction and to the Selector of this DeleteAction.
        Specified by:
        applySubst in class Action
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A new instantiated delete action where (free) variables that are bound by the substitution have been instantiated by the corresponding terms in the substitution.

      • getPrecondition

        public MentalStateCondition getPrecondition(KRlanguage language)
                                throws GOALParseException
        The precondition of a DeleteAction is true, or, to be more precise "bel(true)"; this means it can always be performed if the Update to the BeliefBase is closed.
        Specified by:
        getPrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        language - The KR language used for representing the precondition.
        Returns:
        The MentalStateCondition "bel(true)".
        Throws:
        GOALParseException - In case the KR parser had a problem parsing "true".

      • evaluatePrecondition

        public DeleteAction evaluatePrecondition(MentalState mentalState,
                                Debugger debugger,
                                boolean last)
        Checks whether the precondition of DeleteAction holds. See also: getPrecondition(KRlanguage).
        Specified by:
        evaluatePrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        mentalState - The MentalState in which the precondition is evaluated.
        debugger - The current debugger
        last - If this is the last possible variation we are trying to execute, e.g. after this there are no more possibilities and the action will fail.
        Returns:
        true since delete has "empty" precondition.

      • executeAction

        protected Result executeAction(RunState<?> runState,
                   Debugger debugger)
        Executes the Action.
        Executes the DeleteAction by applying the Updates to the BeliefBase and/or mail box. Also may update the GoalBase if a goal holds after the update; those goals are removed.
        Specified by:
        executeAction in class Action
        Parameters:
        runState - The RunState in which the action is executed.
        debugger - The current debugger.
        Returns:
        The action that has been executed; never returns null but throws runtime exceptions if executing the action fails.
